intro: Elatostema angusticuneatum, commonly known as narrow-leaf false shamrock, is a small herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and trifoliate leaves with three oval, pointed lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Elatostema angusticuneatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
